title: Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 421 of 2016)),
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the National Oil Reserves Agency Act
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 

2007 (Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation Rate) Order 2022. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 1 January 2023.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited national oil reserve agency act 2007 (renewable transport fuel obligation rate) order 2022 (2) order come operation 1 january 2023

title: Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 421 of 2016)),
heading: 2. The percentage rate referred to in section 44C(3)(b) of the National Oil
text_raw:
2. The percentage rate referred to in section 44C(3)(b) of the National Oil 
Reserves Agency Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) in respect of the renewable 
transport fuel obligation shall be 16.985 per cent.
text_norm: 2 percentage rate referred section 44c(3)(b) national oil reserve agency act 2007 (no 7 2007) respect renewable transport fuel obligation shall 16.985 per cent

title: Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 421 of 2016)),
heading: 3. The National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (Biofuel Obligation Rate)
text_raw:
3. The National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (Biofuel Obligation Rate) 

Order 2022 (S.I. No. 21 of 2022) is revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 December, 2022. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, Climate and 
Communications. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [709] 3

title: Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 421 of 2016)),
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

To come into effect on 1 January 2023, this regulation sets the percentage rate 
referred to in section 44C(3)(b) of the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 
(No. 7 of 2007) to be 16.985 per cent, thereby replacing the National Oil 
Reserves Agency Act 2007 (Biofuel Obligation Rate) Order 2022 (S.I. No. 21 
of 2022). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [709]
